Definition: Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) is a condition in which a blood clot forms in a deep vein, usually in the legs.
Causes: Prolonged inactivity, certain medical conditions, and some medications.
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, and tenderness in the affected leg.
Treatment: Anticoagulants, compression stockings, and in some cases, thrombolysis.

Definition: Dementia is a general term for a decline in mental ability severe enough to interfere with daily life.
Causes: Alzheimer's disease, vascular issues, and other neurological conditions.
Symptoms: Memory loss, difficulty communicating, and impaired reasoning.
Diagnosis: Cognitive tests, medical history, and brain imaging.
Treatment: Medications, cognitive therapies, and supportive care.

Definition: Dementia with Lewy bodies is a type of progressive dementia characterized by abnormal protein deposits in the brain.
Causes: The exact cause is unknown, but it involves the accumulation of Lewy bodies in the brain.
Symptoms: Visual hallucinations, fluctuating cognition, and movement disorders.
Treatment: Medications for cognitive symptoms and supportive therapies.

Definition: Dermatitis is an inflammation of the skin that can cause redness, itching, and discomfort.
Causes: Allergens, irritants, and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Red, inflamed skin, itching, and sometimes blisters.
Treatment: Topical treatments, antihistamines, and avoiding triggers.

Definition: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans is a rare skin cancer that starts in the connective tissue.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but it may be related to genetic mutations.
Symptoms: A firm, raised area of skin that may be brown or purple.
Treatment: Surgical removal and sometimes radiation therapy.

Definition: Dermatomyositis is an inflammatory disease characterized by muscle weakness and a distinctive skin rash.
Causes: Autoimmune response, possibly triggered by infections or medications.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, skin rash, and fatigue.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, muscle biopsy, and imaging.
Treatment: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, and physical therapy.

Definition: Desmoid tumors are benign growths that arise from connective tissue and can be aggressive.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but they may be associated with genetic conditions.
Symptoms: A firm mass that may cause pain or discomfort.
Treatment: Surgery, observation, and sometimes medication.

Definition: A deviated septum occurs when the cartilage that divides the nasal cavity is off-center.
Causes: Congenital or due to injury.
Symptoms: Difficulty breathing through the nose, nasal congestion.
Treatment: Nasal decongestants, surgery (septoplasty) in severe cases.

Definition: Diabetes is a chronic condition that occurs when the body cannot effectively use insulin.
Causes: Genetic factors, obesity, and lifestyle choices.
Symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, and fatigue.
Treatment: Insulin therapy, oral medications, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Diabetes in pregnancy, or gestational diabetes, is a form of diabetes that develops during pregnancy.
Causes: Hormonal changes during pregnancy affecting insulin.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic, but may include increased thirst and urination.
Treatment: Dietary changes, exercise, and sometimes insulin.

Definition: A diaphragmatic hernia occurs when there is an abnormal opening in the diaphragm.
Causes: Congenital defect or injury.
Symptoms: Difficulty breathing, rapid breathing, and cyanosis.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies such as X-rays or CT scans.
Treatment: Surgical repair of the hernia.

Definition: Diarrhea is characterized by frequent, loose, or watery bowel movements.
Causes: Infections, food intolerances, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Frequent bowel movements, abdominal cramps, and dehydration.
Treatment: Rehydration, dietary changes, and medications as needed.

Definition: Dysphagia is a condition characterized by difficulty swallowing.
Causes: Neurological disorders, esophageal problems, and muscle issues.
Symptoms: Pain while swallowing, sensation of food getting stuck.
Treatment: Swallowing therapy, dietary modifications, and medications.

Definition: Dilated cardiomyopathy is a condition where the heart becomes enlarged and weakened.
Causes: Genetic factors, viral infections, and alcohol abuse.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs.
Treatment: Medications, lifestyle changes, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Diphtheria is a serious bacterial infection affecting the mucous membranes of the throat.
Causes: Infection with the bacterium Corynebacterium diphtheriae.
Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, and a thick coating in the throat.
Treatment: Antibiotics and diphtheria antitoxin.

Definition: Diverticulitis is the inflammation or infection of small pouches that can form in the walls of the colon.
Causes: Increased pressure in the colon leading to pouch formation.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, fever, and changes in bowel habits.
Treatment: Antibiotics, dietary changes, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Dizziness is a term used to describe a range of sensations, including feeling faint or unsteady.
Causes: Inner ear problems, dehydration, and low blood pressure.
Symptoms: Lightheadedness, spinning sensation, and balance issues.
Treatment: Hydration, medications, and balance therapy.

Definition: Down syndrome is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of an extra chromosome 21.
Causes: Genetic mutation during cell division.
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, characteristic facial features, and developmental delays.
Treatment: Early intervention, educational support, and therapies.

Definition: A drug allergy is an abnormal reaction of the immune system to a medication.
Causes: Immune response to a drug, often due to previous exposure.
Symptoms: Rash, itching, swelling, and in severe cases, anaphylaxis.
Treatment: Avoidance of the drug and management of symptoms.

Definition: Drug-induced pulmonary disease refers to lung damage caused by medications.
Causes: Certain medications that can cause inflammation or toxicity in the lungs.
Symptoms: Cough, shortness of breath, and chest pain.
Treatment: Discontinuation of the offending drug and supportive care.

Definition: Dry eye is a condition where the eyes do not produce enough tears or the right quality of tears.
Causes: Aging, certain medications, and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Dryness, irritation, and redness in the eyes.
Diagnosis: Eye examination and tear production tests.
Treatment: Artificial tears, lifestyle changes, and medications.

Definition: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is a non-invasive breast cancer that starts in the milk ducts.
Causes: Genetic mutations and hormonal factors.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic, but may present as a lump or abnormal mammogram.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and sometimes hormone therapy.

Definition: Dupuytren's contracture is a condition that causes the fingers to bend towards the palm.
Causes: Genetic factors and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Thickening of the tissue under the skin of the palm.
Treatment: Surgery and needle aponeurotomy in severe cases.

Definition: A dural arteriovenous fistula is an abnormal connection between an artery and a vein in the dura mater.
Causes: Trauma, congenital factors, or unknown causes.
Symptoms: Headaches, vision changes, and neurological deficits.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies such as MRI or angiography.
Treatment: Endovascular treatment or surgery.

Definition: Dyspepsia is a term used to describe discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen.
Causes: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), ulcers, and food intolerances.
Symptoms: Bloating, nausea, and stomach pain.
Treatment: Dietary changes, medications, and lifestyle modifications.

Definition: Dystonia is a movement disorder characterized by involuntary muscle contractions.
Causes: Genetic factors, brain injury, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Abnormal postures, twisting movements, and discomfort.
Treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.
